daily_fact: New York City's initiative to implement car-free 'snow routes' in the past showcased innovative thinking, demonstrating the community's commitment to improving street safety and accessibility during winter storms.
topline_md: Recent updates from New York City include two highway fatalities, four pediatric flu deaths, and an apartment fire that claimed an 81-year-old man's life. Additionally, Mayor Mamdani signed an executive order to enhance sanctuary protections, while the city faces ongoing challenges with healthcare staffing shortages and snow removal responsibilities.

risks_alerts.title: Risks & Alerts
risks_alerts.summary_md:
### Risks & Alerts

- Two fatalities reported on NY highways, including a man attempting to cross the Major Deegan. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiyAFBVV95cUxONlJqUzhVdlVoYktZcjRLdFZodjI5NUlXZm5MRFpFZU52X3p3NEtJR0d5am9wSWNLQWxTSzNWVUg3RWZHNUFuWGhIYV9UdDVPOUxpeDktY2RCWjRCQlJscDBXNW1pMlpIU01RNVJzUzBXdnc2R09mRzdDa3NuOUt2MjA0NjVTcW1ZYnp4X0FMMFBwNkdzVVptZkVxNVZYekNqcmtWcjAwNlYweG1fb3RlTzJXc1JYMEFSdUYtWmpQR2pud2xla1VnTw?oc=5)

- Nearly 70 people were rescued from malfunctioning gondolas at a New York ski mountain.
